questions.question: I have just …………………. the work.
questions.description: Begun is the past participle of begin. We use the past participle form of the verb after has/have.

questions.question: I …………………. David Copperfield.
questions.description: The present perfect is commonly used to talk about a finished event when its time is not mentioned.

questions.question: I ……………………….. my lunch.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about finished events whose effect is still felt in the present.

questions.question: I ………………………….. him for a long time.
questions.description: The present perfect is common with the time expressions since and for.

questions.question: He ………………………….. to his native place yesterday.
questions.description: The simple past is the most normal tense for talking about finished events.

questions.question: He ………………………… a lot for me when he was alive.
questions.description: The present perfect is more common when there is no time reference.

questions.question: He …………………………. ill since last week.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: I …………………….. for an hour and then I went home.
